name: Healing Yin Yoga Session with Reishi Mushroom
description: We are exciting to bring to you a one of a kind experience at the Studio, the perfect way to unwind and relax on a Sunday evening and get you ready for the week!This event by Nuvedo X Copper + Cloves which is all about exploring and experiencing the amazing healing power of mushrooms!Yin Yoga is a slow yet powerful healing practice where each asana is held for 3-5 minutes at a time. When combined with the soothing properties of reishi mushroom, you can expect to experience a calm and regulated nervous system by the end of this experience!At the start of the candlelit yoga class, led by the wonderful Julia, you will receive a functional mushroom extract dose, reishi, so you can experience the beneficial effects during the class itself.The 90 minute practice will be followed by a sharing feast at the Studio by the Copper + Cloves Chef team. We will incorporate functional mushrooms into the brunch, from pan-fried lion's mane on sourdough, to a reishi-cacao balls.Why we are so excited about this unique event:By receiving these extracts during a yoga class centred on synchronising breath and movement you will get the most out of these amazing mushroomsYou will leave this practice feeling more grounded and embodied.During the sharing-feast we'll all eat together so it's a wonderful chance to meet like-minded people.You'll get the chance to try delicious food including functional mushrooms, so you will also receive the nutritional benefits of these fungi.You will learn more about mushrooms and how they can support your journey to health. The team of experts from Nuvedo will help you understand why the extracts are unique and deep dive into the wonderful world of mushrooms.This will be a truly special experience - if you have ever been curious about functional mushrooms and how they could support your health journey, this is the event for you!

name: ALT EFF 2024 x MEDAI : The Stage
description: Since the dawn of time, storytelling in community has shaped our mindset, our outlook and ultimately, our behaviour. With record heat, oscillating droughts & floods, fires, melting glaciers (and ... you know the rest) our current narrative needs some course correcting.All Living Things Environmental Film Festival (ALT EFF) is back for a 5th edition, pan-India cultural event. Join us at MEDAI for a unique evening of cinema, art & community. Watch award-winning global films on regeneration, activism, resilience and hope and engage in conversations with India’s most inspiring change-makers. Let’s restore the narrative of stewardship, together. All are welcome!PROGRAM:4th December, Wednesday 2:00 - 2:45 PM : Stubble - The Farmer's Bane (Shaz Syed | India | 35 mins | English, Punjabi, Hindi | 2024) INDIA PREMIERE2:45 - 3:15 PM : Burnt Country (Kirsten Slemint | Australia | 17 mins 45 secs | English | 2024) INDIA PREMIERE3:15 - 4:00 PM : Very special panel discussion on Indigenous care of country. 1:10 PM : Some Thoughts on the Common Toad (G. Anthony Svatek | USA | 10 mins 37 secs | English | 2023)  INDIA PREMIERE1:10 - 1:30 PM : Wild Summon (Karni and Saul | UK | 14 mins 39 secs | English | 2023) INDIA PREMIERE1:30 - 1:45 PM : Lunatic Lunatic (Robin Noorda | Netherlands | 16 mins | English | 2024)1:45 - 2:00 PM : Break 2:00 - 2:15 PM : Covered in mud, buried under myths: Red sand boa illegal trade (Shatabdi Charkraborti | India | 13 mins 32 secs | English, Hindi | 2024)2:15 - 2:30 PM : Immaculate (Ningjing Wang | China, UK | 15 mins 40 secs | Chinese, English | 2024) INDIA PREMIERE2:30 - 3:15 PM : Crisis of Consumption: India’s Overwhelming Waste Problem and What We Can Do About It by Consumers for Sustainability 3:15 - 4:30 PM : Nenets vs Gas (Sergio Ghizzardi | France, Belgium, Norway, Finland | 1 hr 14 mins | English, Russian, Nenets | 2023) INDIA PREMIERE4:30 - 5:00 PM : ALT EFF Voices: With prompts and/or select curation provided by us, this is an open-mic for audiences to express themselvesNON FILM PROGRAM: ALT EFF VoicesALT EFF Voices is a dynamic spoken-word platform that will be a key feature of our annual festival, providing a space for individuals to share their personal stories, thoughts, and observations on the pressing environmental challenges we face today. With ALT EFF Voices' inaugural edition during ALT EFF 2024, we hope people of all ages and backgrounds will feel free to channel their grief, anger, hope, and passion into powerful yet creative messages about our environment.Fungal Entanglements: A Sensory Journey by Fungi Foundation‘Fungal Entanglements: A Sensory Journey’ is an immersive workshop that bridges art, science, and traditional ecological knowledge to explore the fascinating world of fungi. This multisensory experience, facilitated by Malavika Bhatia and Prithvi Kini of Fungi Foundation, is designed to engage participants with the often-overlooked realm of fungi, emphasising their ecological roles and relationships with other organisms, including humans.The workshop takes participants on a unique fungal adventure, engaging all five senses to foster a deeper understanding and appreciation of fungi. By intertwining scientific knowledge with sensory experiences and creative expression, the workshop aims to transform participants' perceptions of fungi from potential disgust to wonder and curiosity.Through a series of interactive stations, participants will explore fungal diversity, examine specimens under microscopes, experience various fungal scents and textures, taste edible mushrooms, and even listen to mushroom-generated music. The workshop culminates in an embodied activity where participants creatively express fungal relationships, fostering a personal connection to these remarkable organisms.Speaker’s Bio:Prithvi Kini is an entrepreneur, yoga practitioner, citizen scientist, and mental health advocate with a deep interest in the therapeutic benefits of mushrooms. As the co-founder of Nuvedo, India's pioneering functional mushroom start-up, her vision is for people to reclaim control of their lives through mushrooms. Through Nuvedo, she forges connections with local farming communities and myriad mycophiles across India and is fostering a mushroom revolution that goes beyond the world of business. With Fungi Foundation India, she's on a mission to revolutionize India's allyship with fungi, not just on a plate but in policy as well. With a commitment to conservation, her interests focus on ethical biodiversity research and Indian ethnomycological exploration. Her vision is to create a kinder, authentic and more accepting India through the power of fungi and applying to rekindle a ‘more-than-human’ outlook on our ways of life.Malavika Bhatia is a forager, artist, and community facilitator who weaves together ethnomycological research, community-based practices, and theoretical frameworks to reimagine relationships in the more-than-human world. Their art practice inhabits spaces of decay and decomposition, viewing these processes not as endpoints but as vital sites of regeneration and possibility. Through programs with Science Gallery Bengaluru, Kiran Nadar Museum of Art, Sandbox Collective, Serendipity Arts Festival, and others, they create participatory experiences that invite audiences to consider how fungal networks can serve as both metaphor and method for reimagining community relationships and ecological entanglements.Community Campaigning: Success Stories and A Pathway to Change	The session will be a deep-dive into the importance of engaging with communities for grassroots advocacy initiatives and impactful public mobilization through digital media. Jhatkaa.org will reflect on learnings from its successful campaigns that have harnessed the power of community support to create impact on a range of issues including environmental issues, social justice, and better urban planning. Additionally, successful local campaign case studies will also be sharedSpeaker’s Bio: Divya is the Executive Director of Jhatkaa.org, where she leads efforts to build an equitable, inclusive, and sustainable India. With a Master's degree in Public Health and Human Rights, Divya has over 12 years of experience working at the intersection of grassroots activism and digital advocacy, addressing critical issues in climate change, public health, and social justice.At Jhatkaa.org, she works with a team of campaigners and technologists to design and execute campaigns on a range of issues, including climate change, gender and sexuality, women's rights, and social justice. Jhatkaa.org leverages innovative technology and public mobilization to foster a movement of engaged and progressive Indians, empowering individuals to take collective action for systemic change.Divya also serves as an advisor and mentor to a regenerative communications agency, a trans rights organization, and other individual changemakers in India.Mongabay discussion moderated by ALT EFF rep Wild Frequencies at ALT EFFScience, Sound, and Story Walk into a PodcastJoin Abhijit Shylanath as he presents his experience working as a sound designer for Mongabay India’s Wild Frequencies. In this session, Abhijit will reveal the art and science behind using sound as the focal point to drive stories, creating impactful narratives without visuals. He will discuss the sound design process, editing techniques, and the essential role of editorial support in crafting powerful audio narratives. Abhijit brings unique insights on how to balance artistic storytelling with journalistic integrity, offering valuable lessons in creating compelling soundscapes that resonate with listeners.Speaker’s BioAbhijit Shylanath is a self-taught musician, producer, and audio editor. He has been making original music since age five and has a broad sonic palette from folk to indie rock to cinematic scores. Qualified as a computer engineer, he chose to work instead as a studio producer. He has 20+ years of experience making music for movies, corporate identities, events, video games, and ad campaigns. He is particularly interested in podcasts as a medium of communicating ideas and data, and believes that they have, like music, a deceptively long history of oral tradition behind them.Crisis of Consumption: India’s Overwhelming Waste Problem and What We Can Do About It What do fast fashion and animal agriculture have in common? This talk dives into the hidden impacts of our everyday choices and their toll on the environment. From the dyes in our clothing to the materials we often overlook, consumption patterns are driving a crisis. Color Ashram Foundation brings awareness to the toxic dyes used in the fashion industry and the massive waste created as a result. Consumers for Sustainability highlights the environmental costs of animal-derived materials like wool, leather, and silk—showing how these products consume water, pollute air and soil, and deplete precious land resources. Join us to discover the real costs behind these industries and explore pathways toward more sustainable choices.Speaker’s Bio:Seemanthini C. is the Project Coordinator at Consumers for Sustainability, an initiative dedicated to promoting consumer protection and fostering sustainable practices across sectors. With a background in biotechnology and a wealth of experience in organising educational camps and outreach programs, she is a strong advocate for capacity and community building. She believes these are essential tools for creating a ripple effect that strengthens the sustainability movement and inspires meaningful change.Moving Into A Climate Solutions Economy: Climate Futures and the role of Forests by Land Conflict WatchIndia has announced that it would create an additional carbon sink of 3.0 billion tonnes by increasing forest cover by 2030. To achieve this, the country has put in place a dedicated policy to carry out afforestation to compensate for the forests it loses to industries and other project developers. However, how well has this panned out on the ground? Forest communities, who had to give up forest lands that they were dependent on to industries years ago, are now being displaced again as the state is struggling for land to meet its afforestation target. Has the role of forests been reduced to only carbon sequestration?  Speaker’s BioKumar Sambhav Shrivastava Founder & Director, Land Conflict WatchKumar Sambhav is a social entrepreneur and award-winning journalist, leading innovative research in accountability investigations. He is the founder of Land Conflict Watch and is currently working as India Research Lead with Princeton University’s Digital Witness Lab. Kumar co-founded The Reporters’ Collective, a non-profit journalism collaborative in India and was an inaugural Artificial Intelligence Accountability Fellow with the Pulitzer Center. Kumar has reported for prime global and Indian news outlets, including Al Jazeera, Huffington Post, Business Standard, Hindustan Times, Down To Earth and The Times of India. He has received the prestigious Red Ink Award, the Press Council of India’s National Award for Excellence in Journalism and the Shriram Award for Excellence in Financial Journalism. Mrinali Advisor & Climate Research Lead, Land Conflict WatchMrinali K works as Advisor & Climate Research Lead, Land Conflict Watch. Her research focuses on issues of climate change and resource conflicts. For more than 6 years now, she has studied issues around land and resource conflicts, working with journalists and researchers to conduct research around the land conflict database. She has also tracked and reported on international climate change negotiations since 2022.

name: In the footsteps of the Tiger of Mysore.
description: Discover the history of Bangalore fort, its tales of glory & treachery over the past five centuries with us.The walk begins with a vegetarian breakfast. After that we take our guests to explore the remnants of Tipu's summer palace, the Bangalore fort & the armory.During the course of the walk learn how Anglo-French wars in Europe & North America had their impact in Southern India too.The guests get to learn more about Tipu's weapons on mass destruction of the 18th century & how they influenced the US national anthem & how one small Southern Indian kingdom was a thorn in the East India Company's rule.

organizer.description: Heritage, food & architectural walks in Bangalore.

name: Once upon a time in Chamarajpet.
description: This is a heritage walk to the first extension to Bengaluru city by the Maharaja of Mysore. This locality was named after a famous Wodeyor ruler & was home to many famous personalities whom we will tell you about on this walk.This area was one of the first in India to have a grid iron plan and was once lined with tree lined avenues. Probably the first layout to also have main & cross roads too. It has many famous hostels restaurants hospitalschurches temples educational institutes and old homes which we intend to tell more about to you.So if you are free this weekend join us on this walk. Also included is breakfast at a legendary outlet in this area.

location.address: Chamrajpet, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

organizer.description: Heritage, food & architectural walks in Bangalore.

name: River Realms: An Immersive VR experience @ BIC
description: This event is a part of Bengaluru Hubba, a citywide Arts and Culture fest from Nov 30 - Dec 16Bengaluru—a city of innovation, growth, and resilience, sustaining millions each day. But have you ever wondered what truly fuels this metropolis? Over 100 km away lies its lifeline: the Cauvery River, the single source capable of quenching the city’s vast thirst. Rising to an elevation of 920 meters above sea level, every drop that reaches Bengaluru is part of an awe-inspiring engineering feat, delivering life-giving water across immense distances and elevations. While this feat of human ingenuity is indeed impressive, it underscores a critical reality: the city’s reliance on a distant water source is a fragile solution, one that becomes increasingly unsustainable as demand grows.In this immersive experience on the Apple Vision Pro, transport to the heart of the Cauvery in a way like never before. With stunning 16K 180° video narration, stories of conservation and wildlife, you’ll feel the river’s currents as if you’re standing on its banks, surrounded by the beauty of lush landscapes, misty hills, and abundant wildlife. Glide along the river and experience the peaceful yet powerful journey of its waters, as they make their way to our city.Dive Deeper with AR and 3D ModelsGet up close with interactive 3D models that reveal the rich wildlife, diverse plants, and the complex infrastructure behind this remarkable journey. Watch as dams, pipelines, and pumping stations come to life, illustrating the sophisticated system that transports Cauvery’s finite waters over vast distances to sustain Bengaluru. Feel the river's flow, witness the delicate balance between nature and engineering, and understand both the marvel and the responsibility of relying on a distant water source.An Experience Like No OtherThis is more than just an experience—it’s an invitation to understand the delicate balance that keeps Bengaluru thriving. Join us at Bengaluru Hubba on the Apple Vision Pro for “Bengaluru: A City Fueled by the Cauvery” Discover the lifeblood of our city, and be part of the journey that brings water, life, and hope to millions.

But have you ever wondered what truly fuels this metropolis? Over 100 km away lies its lifeline: the Cauvery River, the single source capable of quenching the city’s vast thirst. Rising to an elevation of 920 meters above sea level, every drop that reaches Bengaluru is part of an awe-inspiring engineering feat, delivering life-giving water across immense distances and elevations. While this feat of human ingenuity is indeed impressive, it underscores a critical reality: the city’s reliance on a distant water source is a fragile solution, one that becomes increasingly unsustainable as demand grows.In this immersive experience on the Apple Vision Pro, transport to the heart of the Cauvery in a way like never before. With stunning 16K 180° video narration, stories of conservation and wildlife, you’ll feel the river’s currents as if you’re standing on its banks, surrounded by the beauty of lush landscapes, misty hills, and abundant wildlife. Glide along the river and experience the peaceful yet powerful journey of its waters, as they make their way to our city.Dive Deeper with AR and 3D ModelsGet up close with interactive 3D models that reveal the rich wildlife, diverse plants, and the complex infrastructure behind this remarkable journey. Watch as dams, pipelines, and pumping stations come to life, illustrating the sophisticated system that transports Cauvery’s finite waters over vast distances to sustain Bengaluru. Feel the river's flow, witness the delicate balance between nature and engineering, and understand both the marvel and the responsibility of relying on a distant water source.An Experience Like No OtherThis is more than just an experience—it’s an invitation to understand the delicate balance that keeps Bengaluru thriving. Join us at Bengaluru Hubba on the Apple Vision Pro for “Bengaluru: A City Fueled by the Cauvery” Discover the lifeblood of our city, and be part of the journey that brings water, life, and hope to millions.

name: The Breakfast Club
description: We’re excited to invite you to an exclusive breakfast and coffee preview of Muro Café, where Bangalore will experience the best of Asian breakfast and a celebration of Single Origin Coffees of Karnataka’s finest coffee estates. Join us on every Saturday & Sunday for our Asian breakfast menu.From 9 a.m. to 12:00 p.m., experience Muro Cafe's unique twist on breakfast; from rich Crab Omelettes and indulgent Hong Kong French Toast to creamy Basque Cheesecake & more.Celebrate food, community, and the joy of coming together. Muro: https://www.instagram.com/murocafeblr/

name: Magic: The Gathering with ReRoll Board Games
description: After many years of talking about this, we’re finally starting a Magic: The Gathering meetup. If you are curious about this massively popular card game, or are already a player looking to find others to play with in-person, this is for you!For people who’ve never played before:This is designed for new players to explore the game. We’ll teach you the rules, and will pair up new players with each other. We’ll be playing the with 40-card decks, using the Jumpstart 2022 set - which is a great way to learn the game without too much time on deck building.For experienced playersWe have a few premade standard (60 card) decks to play, as well a few commander decks.This is a light, friendly environment for players to explore the game and meet the community - it is not a competitive event. Be helpful, and expect people to make mistakes.

name: Once upon a time in Johnson market.
description: Join us for a walk through Johnson Market and its surrounding areas discovering this quaint British-era marketplace from a fresh perspective. We'll delve into the area's unique Shia heritage tracing back to a Persian man who made this place his home decades ago. Few people know about the roads and localities named after him and his descendants—a fascinating piece of Bangalore’s history.Our journey includes a stop at a legendary local bakery sipping on Sulaimani chai learning about the martyrs of Karbala and visiting a historic church.We’ll begin with a brief introduction to the area before exploring its heritage sites. Along the way you’ll enjoy a taste of local delicacies in between the stories of history.**Instructions:**- Wear comfortable footwear and bring a cap.- Since we’ll visit places of worship please dress respectfully.- Photography is allowed at most locations unless otherwise noted.

name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

name: Dialogues with Books
description: Dialogues with Books Join us for our book club meetup every third Sunday of the month. Bring along your favorite book, the book you are currently reading, or any book that had an impact on you. Share your experience reading the book with fellow bibliophiles and participate in winding and fun discussions around the joy of reading. Do all this while sipping on coffee/tea or having a hot tasty snack from our cafe! Your Host - Bharat is an avid reader with a penchant for classical literature and philosophy. He also dabbles in writing with a diverse portfolio of works across tech, philosophy, magical realism and fantasy. His reading diet includes a mix of fiction and non-fiction with his favorite novels being The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Movable feast by Hemmingway and Crime and Punishment by Dostoevsky.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

name: Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam
description: Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam - A room. Some beanbags and cushions. Souls lost in Hindi poetry and Urdu verse. Open the doors, and enter the world of Bachchan, Dinkar, Akhtar, Ghalib, Sahir, and others.With Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam, we bring to you an evening of hour-long recital of poetry written by masters of Hindi and Urdu. Interspersed in these recitals are stories of their life, translations of their works and a discovery of the nuances in their written word. Once in a while, you might find a surprise - a little something out of the box designed for the lover of poetry.Come join us - the mehfil awaits. (Please note: This is NOT an Open Mic)—-Abhilash is an entrepreneur, a corporate educator, and a storyteller. He has spent much of his life reading, memorising and reciting poems of great Hindi/Urdu poets. For years, he has shared this love for poetry with close friends, colleagues and family.Radha is a story-teller, chemistry researcher, traveller, writer, mythology buff, mother, product builder, and bathroom singer - in no particular order. She grew up surrounded by the works of some of our best poets, with her mother reciting Bachchan and Dinkar and her father playing ghazals on the old tape recorder. What started as their separate childhood passions, now finds a collective expression in Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam

name: Pettah walk in Cottonpet : In search of faith.
description: In our fourth walk in the Pettah area we take the guests on a journey in search of "Faith".On this walk in the western part of Kempe Gowda's Pettah area we visit the shrine of the biggest Sufi dargah in Bangalore. We not only learn more about Sufism but learn about how this dargah has promoted communal harmony since the past two centuries and more.We then visit an ayurvedic massage center to see how bones are set right. Legend has it that at one of these centers was patronized by the Maharaja of Mysore as would the pehelwans in these areas who practiced khusti in the numerous akhadas.We also visit an old temple/s associated with a saint/s who left his/their mark on the locality. If time permits we will also visit a garadi mane & a heritage lodge close by.Last but not the least we treat our guests to a nice traditional South Indian breakfast at a heritage restaurant in the area.

name: Roots of Resilience: Discover the Art of Gardening
description: Immerse yourself in the serene beauty of nature with a hands-on gardening workshop designed to help you cultivate both thriving plants and a sense of inner calm.This 90-minute experience is perfect for anyone looking to learn the fundamentals of gardening while exploring how this mindful practice can reduce stress, enhance well-being, and nurture personal growth. From connecting with the earth to tending to your own patch of greenery, you’ll walk away with practical skills and a renewed sense of balance.🌱 What You’ll Experience:A calming, outdoor space perfect for learning and relaxation.Step-by-step guidance on gardening essentials, from planting to care.The joy of digging into the soil and reconnecting with nature’s rhythms.Insights into how gardening fosters resilience and mindfulness.Whether you're an experienced gardener or new to the practice, this workshop is tailored for all skill levels. Tools and materials are provided, and activities are adapted to ensure accessibility and comfort for everyone.What to Bring:Comfortable, outdoor-appropriate clothing.A willingness to get your hands dirty and your heart refreshed.Join us for this grounding experience, where you’ll grow more than just a garden—you’ll grow yourself.🌿 Spaces are limited—reserve your spot now!

name: Cubbon Park Walk & Journalling Workshop
description: Join artist Kavita Arvind & writer Suchi Govindarajan for a mindful and creative morning at Cubbon Park. Learn about trees on a short walk (1.5 to 2km) and begin your own nature journal filled with art and observations.This is a 3-hour curated experience, perfect for anyone who loves nature and would like to deepen their understanding of the natural world.🌿Connect to trees through stories and poems and close observation.🌿Learn to begin a nature journal, by picking up and drawing leaves, seeds and flowers.🌿No experience required! All you need is a curious mind.

name: Conscious Connected Breathwork with Akanksha
description: We're so excited to host Akanksha at the Studio in Bangalore. Akanksha is a breathwork coach and spiritual mentor, empowering people to tap into their aliveness, heal themselves through processing stored emotions and trauma, regulating their nervous system, expanding their capacity to receive and hold more aligned abundance & a higher quality of human experience for themselvesSacred Womb Wellness WorkshopConnecting with our life force energy and activating our divine womb space for deep healing and expansion through movement & conscious connected breathwork. This event is for women only. The flow of the workshop will be:- Opening the circle- connecting exercises involving movement + breath to bring everybody into the space & in their bodies- cleansing everyone's energetic field- explanation of the breath & info on effects- everybody will be lying down for the conscious connected breathwork & breathing to a personally curated music playlist & Akanksha's guidance- spaciousness/grounding, bringing everybody back to the space- integration & sharing- closing the circle-herbal tea, nourishing smoothie bowls and bliss balls by Copper + Cloves - goodbyesFor the Workshop please carry your own:~ Yoga Mat~ Light blanket (body experiences temperature changes so this is highly recommended)~ Comfy, stretchy, loose clothes~ A bottle of drinking water~ Eye mask~ Kindly refrain from eating heavy, 1.5-2 hours before the workshop*Please make sure you arrive on time*

name: Kerala Chronicles
description: As our next pop-up, we bring to you Kerala Chronicles by Chef AmmuJoin us for a culinary journey into the heart of Kerala with Chef Ammu, the talent behind Rebecca’s Kitchen in Chennai. With roots in Central Travancore cuisine, Ammu brings to life the rich, authentic flavours passed down through generations of her family. This Syrian Christian meal is inspired by recipes lovingly handed down from her mother and grandmother, each dish is a tribute to tradition and the joy of good food that evokes cherished memories.MENU - Welcome DrinkBanana (fruit) Wine / Amla Shots Amuse BoucheKallumakkai varattiuathu / Kappa vada First StarterVegetarian: Vattayappam kadachakka curry (miniature )Non Vegetarian: Kari Meen Pollichathu Second StarterVegetarian: Bamboo Puttu Payar PapadamNon Vegetarian: Pazham Pori Beef Swap Dish for Beef / FishPidiyum Kozhiyum (Steamed rice balls and spicy chicken Roast) First Main CourseVegetarian: Appam veg stew Non Vegetarain: Appam with Duck RoastSecond Main courseVegetarian : Neichoru Vegetable Mappas & Ulli theeyalNon Vegetarian: Talassery prawn Biriyani DessertWarm - Ela AdaCold - Elaneer Pudding﻿Table accompanimentsTenga Chutta chammanthi Manga chammanthi Nellika chammandhi Chemmeen chammandhy (dried prawns )Terms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked. With roots in Central Travancore cuisine, Ammu brings to life the rich, authentic flavours passed down through generations of her family. This Syrian Christian meal is inspired by recipes lovingly handed down from her mother and grandmother, each dish is a tribute to tradition and the joy of good food that evokes cherished memories.MENU - Welcome DrinkBanana (fruit) Wine / Amla Shots Amuse BoucheKallumakkai varattiuathu / Kappa vada First StarterVegetarian: Vattayappam kadachakka curry (miniature )Non Vegetarian: Kari Meen Pollichathu Second StarterVegetarian: Bamboo Puttu Payar PapadamNon Vegetarian: Pazham Pori Beef Swap Dish for Beef / FishPidiyum Kozhiyum (Steamed rice balls and spicy chicken Roast) First Main CourseVegetarian: Appam veg stew Non Vegetarain: Appam with Duck RoastSecond Main courseVegetarian : Neichoru Vegetable Mappas & Ulli theeyalNon Vegetarian: Talassery prawn Biriyani DessertWarm - Ela AdaCold - Elaneer Pudding﻿Table accompanimentsTenga Chutta chammanthi Manga chammanthi Nellika chammandhi Chemmeen chammandhy (dried prawns )Terms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked. Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. Incase you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: Design Your 2025: Life Edition
description: Are you familiar with that year-end mix of anticipation, anxiety, and uncertainty about the future? Well, then, ‘Design Your 2025’ (DY25) is for you! A workshop where you can lean in, take charge and craft a blueprint for your new year! In a world where so much can feel unpredictable, it’s easy to get swept up in the rush or feel overwhelmed. DY25 is about clarity and direction. Whether you’re looking to bring more purpose to your work, clarity to your personal life, or simply create space to breathe and reset, this experience invites you to reflect, connect with your aspirations and create a thoughtful, intentional plan — free from external pressures and the frenetic rush of typical New Year resolutions.In this interactive 120-minute session, you will embark on a reflective journey to design your ideal 2025. Through multiple guided activities like year audit, visioning exercise, and creative vision boarding, you will explore where you are today, envision your ideal future, and set meaningful intentions for the year ahead. This workshop combines introspection and creativity, allowing each person to craft a unique roadmap for their life in 2025. The experience concludes with group sharing to foster community and accountability, ensuring everyone leaves inspired and empowered to bring their vision to life.Workshop Dates & Timings:Dec 7th Saturday 9:00am - 11:00am ISTJan 11th Saturday 9:00am - 11:00am ISTJan 12th Sunday 9:00am - 11:00am ISTWorkshop Fees: INR 1500 for individual and INR 1200 for groups of 3+ Please Note: The Life Edition of the Workshop is currently scheduled to happen in-person in Bangalore only.

name: Salsa + Tapas Night with Nutty Gritties
description: Step into a Sunday like no other—a day of movement, connection, and rediscovering balance! Imagine immersing yourself in the joy of salsa, where rhythm fuels your energy, and connection enriches your soul. This is not just a dance class; it’s an experience designed to align your body and mind as part of our huNGer for Balance belief. This beginner-friendly couples salsa session, led by Archana and Raghu of the ShArA Salsa and Latin Institute, will not only teach you the basics of salsa partner work but also offer a chance to immerse yourself in movement that energizes the mind and uplifts the spirit.After the dance, savour a delicious tapas-style dinner thoughtfully curated by the Copper + Cloves chef team and sponsored by Nutty Gritties. Let this experience remind you that finding balance—between learning, moving, and nourishing—is truly an act of self-care.P.S. Whether it’s your partner, best friend, parent, or anyone who lifts your spirit, bring them along to share this experience—you’ll laugh, you’ll learn, and you’ll probably get your feet tangled together. Worth it!

name: Home Alone (1990) Screening | Family Movie Night
description: Family Movie Night at The Studio, Courtyard, ShantinagarJoin us as we watch a series of carefully curated rare masterpieces from around the world, made just for kids. Watch this film while cozying up with your family!About the movie:Home Alone (1990) is a family comedy that follows Kevin McCallister, an eight-year-old boy accidentally left behind when his family departs for a Christmas vacation. Initially thrilled to have the house to himself, Kevin soon finds himself defending it from two bumbling burglars, Harry and Marv, using clever and hilariously painful traps. As Kevin learns the value of family and courage, the movie delivers heartwarming moments amid the laughs. Directed by Chris Columbus and starring Macaulay Culkin, Home Alone became a holiday classic for its mix of humor and festive charm.Why should your kid attend this screening? Classic Holiday Tale: Home Alone introduces children to a heartwarming, festive story filled with humor and adventure.Resilience & Creativity: Kevin’s inventive ways of defending his home inspire problem-solving and quick thinking.Cultural Icon: As a beloved holiday classic, watching Home Alone connects children to a piece of pop culture history.Community Viewing Experience: Enjoying the film in a shared space enhances the joy and excitement of the story, creating lasting memories.And of course, it's Home Alone!!!Join us for Family Movie Night – where the magic of storytelling knows no bounds!Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.The Event is taking place at Courtyard's indoor Studio space on the second floor.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Children above the age of 3 need a ticket to attend the event.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. name: Clueless Crossword by Quiz Pro Quo
description: Are you ready to tackle the ultimate brain-teasing challenge? Gather your team and step into the world of Clueless Crossword, where solving the puzzle means asking the right questions!Here’s the twist:• We’ve created a crossword with 20 answers, but there are no direct clues.• Each clue is the last name of a popular person. Think you can figure out who they are?• Teams take turns asking yes/no questions to narrow down the possibilities.• Example: “Is 2 down a musician?” or “Is 5 across a historical figure?”• Keep going until someone cracks the grid and takes the crown!Whether you’re a trivia master, a crossword enthusiast, or just love a fun challenge, this is your chance to shine. Come solo or bring a team, your wits, and your best questions!About Quiz Pro Quo?QPQ is a community to introduce people to quizzing. They come together every week to crack questions on everyday topics. They have been hosting quizzes online and in person since May 2020. You can follow QPQ on their Instagram @quiz.pro.quo
